Method Detail

getAbsoluteJobDir

String getAbsoluteJobDir()
Returns the absolute url of the job directory. It either gets calculated if the job is not submitted yet or it returns the result of the ServiceInterface#getJobDirectory(String) method if the job is already submitted. If the job directory can't be determined, this method returns null.

Returns:
the absolute url of the job directory or null

getApplicationName

String getApplicationName()
Returns the applicationName. Using the application name is optional (otherwise the default "generic" is used) but recommended so possible output viewer plugins can determine which viewer to use. Also, later on GrisuClient might use mds to auto-calculate a submission location using mds and load appropriate modules. In this case the application name would be necessary.

Returns:

getArguments

String[] getArguments()
The arguments of the commandline (like: new String[]{"-p", "parameter", "-v"}).

Returns:
the arguments

getEmailAddress

String getEmailAddress()

String getExecutablesName()
The name of the executable.

Returns:
the name of the executable.

String[] getInputFiles()

getJobname

String getJobname()
Returns the name of the job.

Returns:
the name of the job.

getMemory

getNoCPUs

int getNoCPUs()

getStderr

String getStderr()
The name of the stderr file (e.g. "stderr.txt").

Returns:
the name of the stderr file

getStdout

String getStdout()
The name of the stdout file (e.g. "stdout.txt").

Returns:
the name of the stdout file

getSubmissionLocation

String getSubmissionLocation()

getUserExecutionHostFs

String getUserExecutionHostFs()
Returns the userexecutionhostfs (aka mountpoint) of the job. This is calculated depending on the submission location and the VO that is used to submit the job. This method will most likely return null if not called in "submit" mode.

Returns:
the userexectutionhostfs or null

getVO

String getVO()

getWalltimeInSeconds

int getWalltimeInSeconds()

getWorkingDirectory

String getWorkingDirectory()
Returns the workind directory of the job relatve to the output of the getUserExecutionHostFs() method. Only returns something that makes sense if called in "submit" mode because otherwise important parameters to calculate it aren't present.

Returns:
the working directory relative to the userexecutionhostfs or null
